DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study examine effect time administration intravenous ( IV ) acetaminophen time relates analgesic efficacy measure postoperative pain score . A maximum 138 patient meet inclusion criterion present schedule total hip replacement general anesthesia randomize one two arm : 1 ) closure group receive first dose one gram intravenous acetaminophen administer upon onset skin closure , 2 ) preemptive group receive first dose one gram intravenous acetaminophen administer within 60 minute prior incision . Both group receive subsequent dose one gram intravenous acetaminophen every 6 hour x 24 hour . The maximum dose 24 hour period exceed 4 gram accord FDA recommendation .
DOC.criteria: Patients 3075 year age weigh ≥55 kg schedule elective total hip arthroplasty perform general anesthesia include . As determined anesthesia team assign case , eligible patient also assign ASA physical status I , II , III deem capable reporting perceive pain use numeric pain scale capable operate patient control anesthesia ( PCA ) device . Exclusion criterion include know allergy , hypersensitivity , contraindication acetaminophen , history alcohol drug abuse , prisoner , emergency THAs , patient chronic malnutrition body mass index ( BMI ) < 18 kg/m2 nonEnglish speaking patient . Additional exclusion criterion include impaired liver function define AST ALT ≥ twice normal limit renal dysfunction ( creatinine > 2.0 mg/dl ) .
